Title: Facility cum Admin Lead
Company: Công Ty TNHH Ajax Systems Việt Nam
Location: KCN Minh Đức, Hưng Yên, Mỹ Hào, Hưng Yên, Việt Nam, near VSIP Hải Dương, Hà Nội, Vietnam, KCN Minh Đức, Hưng Yên, My Hao District, Hung Yen, Vietnam
Job Description:
Position Summary
This role is responsible for ensuring the effective daily operation of the company’s office and production facility by managing all administrative, facility and site-service activities. This role ensures that the workplace operates smoothly, safely, efficiently, on budget and in compliance with company standards and internal policies, while providing a high-quality internal service experience for employees and visitors. The Administrative Lead acts as the primary coordination point of contact between the local site and the Administrative Department, coordinating contractors, vendors, and internal support functions to deliver high-quality internal services.
Key Objectives
• Maintain full operational readiness, safety and functionality of the facility (office and production site).
• Oversee all facility maintenance, utilities, office fit-out, and workplace improvements.
• Ensure efficient delivery of administrative and site-support services.
• Coordinate administrative and technical support services.
• Coordinate and lead the local administrative team with high-performance standards.
• Manage local vendors and contractors to achieve high service quality and cost efficiency.
• Implement facility-related policies and procedures in line with corporate standards.
• Drive a proactive service culture and ensure high employee satisfaction at the location.

Roles and Responsibilities
1. Facility and Infrastructure Management
o Oversee the daily operational readiness of the facility, ensuring all zones (office, production, warehouse, canteen/pantry, coffee points, restrooms, meeting rooms, security and receptionist areas etc.) are functional and clean.
o Monitor the technical condition of premises, office equipment, and infrastructure.
o Organize and supervise repairs, maintenance, and space rearrangements.
o Coordinate with the landlord and external maintenance providers regarding infrastructure issues.
o Plan and manage office/factory repairs, modifications, expansions, and relocations.
o Maintain facility documentation (floor plans, utilities, diagrams, asset lists…) and ensure compliance with company standards.
o Plan and launch new locations and expand existing ones in accordance with the company’s needs, communicate with landlords, sign lease agreements, and work with vendors and contractors.
o Ensure compliance with Vietnam laws related to facility operations (fire safety, hygiene, waste management, electrical safety, etc.) in coordination with HSE.
o Conduct regular facility inspections (Gemba) and report risks to GM with action plans.

2. Administrative Operations
o Oversee and manage administrative support processes, including stationery, utilities, and household supplies, consumables and workplace assets.
o Ensure effective stock management, timely procurement planning, and cost optimization.
o Supervise shuttle bus arrangements, canteen/catering services, cleaning services, and office services.
o Coordinate courier, postal services, visitor management and reception.
o Support internal events, meetings, senior visits and internal communication logistics by ensuring the availability of required materials and facilities.
o Develop, implement, and maintain administrative SOPs in line with HQ standards.
o Budget planning, control, analysis & optimization.
o Lead continuous improvement initiatives to enhance service quality and efficiency.

3. Contractor and Vendor Management
o Coordinate the work of cleaning, maintenance, and technical service contractors.
o Monitor service quality and ensure contract performance in line with SLAs and KPIs.
o Track service requests, ensure timely resolution, and escalate issues when necessary.
o Maintain vendor database, contracts, and procurement documentation in alignment with HQ.
4. Team Leadership and People Management
o Manage and supervise the on-site administrative team.
o Plan team schedules and distribute daily tasks according to operational priorities.
o Monitor team performance and service quality, providing regular feedback and coaching.
o Conduct briefings and ensure all team members understand their responsibilities and safety requirements.
o Participate in recruitment, onboarding, and training of local admin/facility staff.
o Implement HQ-standard working methods, processes, and reporting tools.
o Foster teamwork, accountability, and continuous improvement within the site services team.

Title: Senior Import And Export Coordinator
Company: Think Global Logistics VN Company Limited
Location: Level 2, 88 George Street, The Rocks, Sydney NSW 2000
Job Description:
Job Description:
The Senior Export/Import Coordinator will play a key role in supporting daily operational activities for both export and import shipments. This includes coordinating bookings, preparing documents, liaising with carriers and agents, and ensuring smooth cargo movement.
You will also collaborate closely with our regional teams to deliver high-quality service and operational reliability for our clients.
Candidates with experience working in SMEs freight forwarding companies and who are comfortable with an all-rounder role are highly preferred.
Key Responsibilities：
• Manage day-to-day export and import operations (booking, schedule coordination, trucking arrangement, cargo tracking).
• Prepare, review and process shipping documents: invoice, packing list, bill of lading, COO, etc.
• Coordinate with shipping lines, co-loaders, customs brokers, transporters, and warehouses.
• Support customs clearance procedures and ensure compliance with Vietnam regulations.
• Communicate effectively with overseas agents and internal regional teams to ensure timely cargo movement.
• Maintain complete and accurate records of shipments and documentation.
• Assist in developing SOPs and improving operational processes for the new Vietnam office.
• Handle basic customer inquiries, provide updates, and resolve shipment-related issues promptly.

Title: Production/ Continuous Improvement Team Leader
Company: Avery Dennison Vietnam
Location: Long Hau IP, Can Giuoc, Long An Province, Nhà Bè, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, Lot E.01, Trung Tam Road, Long Hau IP, Nha Be
Job Description:
ABOUT YOUR ROLE:
Provide supervision and implement all production activities following Avery Dennison’s Corporate Standard towards safety in order to produce high quality products to satisfy customer’s demand on products quality with lowest price and shortest delivery time.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE:

- Lead and Facilitate CI Initiatives: Champion and lead key projects and Kaizen events to drive improvements in safety, quality, delivery, and cost.
- Develop a CI Culture: Train, coach, and mentor team members on CI principles and tools (e.g., 5S, Value Stream Mapping, Root Cause Analysis, Standard Work) to empower them to identify and solve problems.
- Process Analysis & Optimization: Analyze production workflows to identify bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and waste. Develop and implement data-driven solutions and action plans.
- Track & Report Progress: Develop and maintain metrics (KPIs) to measure process performance and the impact of improvement projects. Report on progress to leadership and stakeholders.
- Champion Best Practices: Drive the standardization of processes and ensure best practices are implemented and sustained across shifts and teams.
- Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Production, Quality, Engineering, and other departments to align on improvement priorities and ensure successful project implementation.
- Promote Problem-Solving: Facilitate root cause analysis sessions and guide teams in developing effective and sustainable corrective and preventive actions.
- Drive Engagement: Foster an environment where all employees are actively engaged in identifying and implementing improvements in their daily work.
